Name: Stay TF Inside: The Game of Social Distancing
Description:
A fun, fast-paced card game just for adults.

This card game is all about stocking up so that you survive the pandemic!

Trade, steal, or panic buy as many necessities as you can to reign supreme during quarantine.

The FIRST player to collect 3 full colored ESSENTIAL ITEM sets, WINS!

Quick Play
1. Deal 5 cards to each player & put the rest in the draw pile at the center.
2. The player seated to the left of the dealer starts the round & draws 2 cards.
3. Play up to 3 moves during your turn in any of the following ways:
 - Put TP cards into your "stockpile" as currency
 - Lay Essential Item cards face up on the board in front of you to build your sets
 - Play a Pandemic card of Collect TP to F*ck over other players!

PRO TIP: Always keep a well-stocked pile of TP. You never know when sh*t will hit the fan and you'll have to pay out.

Name: ATS: Freedom's Price – Poland 1
Description:
The Advanced Tobruk System returns to Poland and the very beginning of Hitler's blitzkrieg.  This module contains scenarios set in Sept. 1939 as brave Poles desperately attempt to stave off their relentless German attackers.

Contents:
4 linking map panels, each 18½ x 12½"
8 new scenarios
2 half-countersheets providing Polish infantry, weapons and armoured fighting vehicles
AFV Cards
Two-page Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules

Ownership of the ATS Rulebook, play aids and system markers are required to use this product, along with standard German personnel, weapons and AFV counters.

Name: Monopoly: Biel/Bienne
Description:
Go on a journey of discovery with the MONOPOLY Biel / Bienne

Biel / Bienne is the largest bilingual city in Switzerland and the second largest city in the canton of Bern.

Biel is the regional and economic center for both the Seeland and the Bernese Jura and parts of the canton of Solothurn. 
It also has several universities of applied sciences. 
Bienne is the most important center of the Swiss watch industry, ahead of Le Locle, Grenchen and La Chaux-de-Fonds.

All spaces are in French and German and the game is supplied with two packs of cards, one for each language.

Name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Belgique
Description:
The Tour de Belgique, officially Baloise Belgium Tour, is a stage race.

It is a 4 stage race.

Name: Short Fuse
Description:
Short Fuse is all about not blowing up. Players take turns playing down cards to try and get the other players to accumulate "fuse" cards in their bunker, trying to be the last person to not have played down a bomb card with all three "fuse" cards in their bunker. On their turns, as an extra twist, players have to blindly pick a card from another player's hand and play that down as well.

-description from publisher

Name: Fée Toibelle
Description:
Four pretty fairies are invited to the grand ball of the castle. But before spinning in a carriage dancing under the stars, each must retrieve their crown, necklace, fan and handbag.

—description from the publisher

Name: Commonality
Description:
Commonality is a family card game about collecting stuff you find in common. Find the commonality between things and collect sets of common images.

The compact, travel-friendly game comes with 150 cards showing a variety of images.

Setup:


     Lay nine cards faceup in a 3x3 stockpile
     Maintain a draw pile
     Deal three secret cards to each player
     Maintain a reserve area in front of each player.


Game Play:

On each player’s turn, a player can perform one of the following actions first:


     Moves a card from the stockpile to their “reserve”
     Discards a secret card and replaces it with a new card from the draw pile
     Steals a visible card from an opponent’s reserve to their reserve


Finally, if possible …


     Reveals and collects a set.


Once the draw pile has been depleted, shuffle the discard pile into a new draw pile.

Continue playing until no draw cards remain or are playable.
The winner has the most cards. In case of a tie, the youngest player wins.

Set Collection:

Players use one or more of their secret cards along with one or more reserve cards to make a set of at least three cards. Explain the connection between all these cards then flip upside down as a collection. Draw one or more new cards to maintain three secret cards.

We've suggested about 60 commonalities like:


     round
     scary
     flat
     mammal
     wearable
     on the farm
     sports


—description from the publisher

Name: Sleeping Gods: Kickstarter Edition
Description:
"Are the stars unfamiliar here?" she asked, and the sky grew suddenly dark, the star's patterns alien and exotic. "This is the Wandering Sea. The gods have brought you here, and you must wake them if you wish to return home."

In Sleeping Gods, you and up to 3 friends become Captain Sofi Odessa and her crew, lost in a strange world in 1929 on your steamship, the Manticore. You must work together to survive, exploring exotic islands, meeting new characters, and seeking out the totems of the gods so that you can return home.

Sleeping Gods is a campaign game. Each session can last as long as you want. When you are ready to take a break, you mark your progress on a journey log sheet, making it easy to return to the same place in the game the next time you play. You can play solo or with friends throughout your campaign. It's easy to swap players in and out at will. Your goal is to find at least fourteen totems hidden throughout the world. Like reading a book, you'll complete this journey one or two hours at a time, discovering new lands, stories, and challenges along the way.

Sleeping Gods is an atlas game. Each page of the atlas represents only a small portion of the world you can explore. When you reach the edge of a page and you want to continue in the same direction, you simply turn to a new page and sail onward.

Sleeping Gods is a storybook game. Each new location holds wild adventure, hidden treasures, and vivid characters. Your choices affect the characters and the plot of the game, and may help or hinder your chances of getting home!

Welcome to a vast world. Your journey starts now.

—description from the publisher

The Kickstarter edition came in a bigger and nicer box (featuring gold foil and embossing) than the retail edition, featured a painted ship miniature, and included the Sleeping Gods: Dungeons expansion and a set of metallic coins.

The RVM023 product code on the back of the box also indicates the Kickstarter edition.
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Luminous Ages: Dragon Mode
Description:
Luminous Ages is set apart from other trading card games. Aimed at the veteran and the apprentice Luminous Ages can be played by young and old with any level of experience. A tabletop dragon mode with cooperative and competitive play allows you to play with friends and will become a favourite on family game night. In dragon mode, a player can become the DRAGON MASTER controlling the Dragon Gods unleashing their armies against cooperative players set on the Dragon Master’s defeat. The Dragon Mode game is also a DECK BUILDING GAME for 2 players with many cards and so many options.

—description from the publisher

Name: Capture
Description:
Do you want to play with Vampirella?

Two to four players will travel around the board attempting to capture monsters (or wrest them away from their captors) until they have the entire slate of monsters on one side of the four sided board captured. Play as Adam, Conrad (aka Dr. Van Helsing), Pendragon or even Vampirella herself!

This is one of several somewhat tongue-in-cheek horror games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella, among others) created by Bill DuBay and featuring campy 70's horror board game fun.

The Capture game appeared in Vampirella Magazine #27 (September 1973) inside the cover to cut out and play, as well as separately in a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order (#2661 for $2.50). The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

Name: Port Royal: Big Box
Description:
Port Royal: Big Box contains the Port Royal, the first expansion Just One More Contract..., the second expansion The Adventure Begins..., the Gambler promo card, and the standalone game Port Royal: Make Sail!.

This edition of the game features new graphics and art.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Dragon Dreams: White Wolf Allegiance Deck
Description:
Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!

Includes:

    1 Dragon God
    1 Silva the Grey
    1 Angel Card
    1 Quest Land
    2 Quest Creatures
    5 Core Lands
    10 Dream Lands
    10 White Spells
    8 White Artefacts
    4 Wolf Captuveries
    4 Dragon Constructs
    4 Dragon Birds
    4 Life Structures
    4 Artefacts
    4 Atalantian Towers
    4 Captuveries

Name: Dragon Dreams: Purple Exile & Mischief Deck
Description: Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!

Name: Dragon Dreams: Black Corrupt Nightmare Deck
Description: Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!

Name: Dragon Dreams: Green Nature & Dream Summoning Deck
Description: Dragon Dreams is a Luminous Ages Card Game. It is a stand alone and expandable game. The goal of the game is to raise an army, protect your land and SUMMON A Dragon God! Each carefully designed and balanced deck has it's own unique method of killing their enemy's armies, protecting their own armies and gaining the power to Summon THEIR DRAGON GOD!

Name: Amino: The Ant Game
Description:
Amino is an entertaining strategic tile based game for the whole family. Amino takes players on a journey into the microcosm of ants.

In Amino - The Ant Game you build a microcosm that every time looks different. In this microcosm you manage an ant colony, and to win you must be the first to collect the best resources. To do this, you lay out new paths and open up new resources and hill. With your opponent you fight for these resources and obstruct their pathways. With "Ant cards" you block paths, build bridges, lend wings to your ant, improve their fighting power or change the existing maze of paths.

The goal of the game is to quickly get the best resources for yourself. There are three different resources, which give you one to three points depending on their type. Now, some may be worth more or less to you than they are to your opponent. The first player to collect seven points wins.

Name: Escape The Box: Die vergessene Pyramide
Description:
Erlebt eine Schatzjagd im alten Ägypten und erforscht neun Räume, um dem großen Escape-Room-Spiel gemeinsam zu entkommen. Löst alle Rätsel und findet alle Glyphen, Schätze und Geheimnisse, um die Mission eurer Spielfiguren zu meistern. Mit bis zu 4 Spielern erforscht ihr die sagenumwobene Pyramide, gefüllt mit uralten Mysterien, tückischen Fallen und unbeschreiblichen Reichtümern. Aber nehmt euch vor den ägyptischen Göttern in Acht. Manche könnten euch zwar gewogen sein, andere aber auch euer Verderben bedeuten.

Discover a cooperative adventure in the world of mummies, burial chambers and sand, warm sand everywhere you look! Experience a treasure hunt in ancient Egypt and explore nine rooms in order to escape the great escape room game together. Solve all puzzles and find all glyphs, treasures and secrets to master the mission of your characters. With up to 4 players you explore the legendary pyramid, filled with ancient mysteries, treacherous traps and indescribable riches. But beware of the Egyptian gods. Some could be good for you, but others could also mean your ruin.

Name: Mémotager: Vegetable memory game
Description:
Setup:
Plant all the vegetables: carrots, turnips, radishes... Don't  forget the rabbits! 
Push the wooden vegetables into the felt, only the green stalk must still protrude. 
Finally place the scarecrow in the center to hold everything.

Gameplay:
Mémotager offers two game modes: 

     a classic memory in which identical pairs have to be gathered
     an advanced mode, in which a soup recipe has to be recomposed. The first player to collect the ingredients for their soup wins.

Name: Monster Match
Description:
In Uncle Creepy's Monster Match, you are attempting to amass an army of monsters by collecting two matching monsters from each of the four sides of the game board - the first player to do this wins! And everyone else presumably has a lot of hungry monsters to feed. Will they turn on their captors? You bet!

2 to 6 players spin a paper spinner to move about the board and may claim a monster if they land on it. If you land on an already claimed monster, you must battle the owner for control by betting one of your own monsters against theirs- the highest spin wins them both! As a side option, players may also offer to trade monsters to other players during their turn.

This is one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie, Vampirella and others) featuring rad 70s monster artwork.

Monster Match was released in Creepy Magazine #56 (September 1973), Eerie Magazine #51 (September 1973), and the "Famous Monsters Game Book #1" magazine from June of 1982 as "cut out and play editions", as well as available separately in a bundle as "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order (#2661 for $2.50). The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

Name: Mém'oeufs: Mémo sonore
Description:
Shake the eggs 2 by 2 to find the pairs. 
An original sound memo with no shelf life!

Grab an egg, shake it and try to find the other egg which makes the same sound. A game of listening and awakening the senses with a box of 12 wooden eggs.

Winner is the player who can associate the most sounds.

Name: Le jeu de No
Description:
Le jeu de No , 
the game of No combines luck, strategy and knowledge about the Island of Noirmoutier through questions.

A family game that can be played with children, with questions designed for the younger ones.

Go on foot, by bike, by boat for a fun island tour!

Questions on expressions in patois, activities, the coast, fauna, flora ... not to mention the traffic rules on the road and by the sea.
1,200 questions on Noirmoutier island and on each card a photo of the island.

Name: The Farm Game
Description:
Take on the role of a farmer trying to build up your farm with pigs, cows, chickens, and sheep

Compete with your fellow players doing the same thing. Try to disrupt their farms while protecting your own.

Collect all three pairs of one kind of farm animal to win the game

Use other card types to buy, sell, trade, and support your farm - or to sabotage your neighbors

Make blind trades with your neighboring farmers to get what you need. Trades are limited only by your creativity

You can choose to be honest in your business dealings, but there is no guarantee other players will!

—description from the designer

Name: SCF: BUTTON MASHERS! – Pocket Edition
Description:
BUTTON MASHERS! is a fast-paced, pocket-sized card game for 2 players! Combo punches and kicks while trying to avoid your opponents attacks!

Great to take on the go or for a quick break between larger games, your luck and guessing skills will be put to the test! Guess correctly, and avoid damage. Guess wrong, and you'll take a foot to the face! Don't let your health reach zero!

Variable rules make it easy to adjust the game for all ages! Make it a simple guessing game, or change it up, and make it a game about reading your opponent's moves, or make up your own rules!

Players each have an identical deck of various punches and kicks. After deciding who goes first, the defending player guesses whether the next card to be revealed will be a high(↑), mid, or low(↓) attack. If they guess correctly, they take no damage and become the new attacker. However, if they guess wrong, they take the damage listed on the card and must guess again until they make a correct guess.

For more player control, have the attacking player select which card to put face down instead of just flipping the top card of the deck.

Players start with 25 life. First to reach 0 loses and gives their best cry of defeat!
Ready... FIGHT ON!!!

—description from the designer

Name: Flockade
Description:
Flockade is a laid-back, party game with strategic elements about outwitting and outlasting your opposition.

Command an army of farm animals lead your flock to victory through attacking, defending, deception, and disruption, protecting your general at all costs to be the last flock standing. If your General goes down, you lose the game.

Each general offers its own powerful effect and playstyle to build your flock around. Build an army of basic recruits and powerful heroes to defend your General and attack enemy armies. Use orders to instantly take action or disrupt incoming actions and apply sanctions to other players for powerful shifts in the game if you catch them breaking a treaty!

To win, you'll have to manage your hand wisely and play your cards at the right times for the maximum effect. Shear your enemies with weapons, wolves, and wit to win and wool the world!

—description from the designer

Name: Wish you were here ...? Travel Edition
Description:
What's in the game?
Cards for sevenczones of the world.  Each zone is a different colour and has cards for ten cities (numbered 1-10), plus a Travel Cuide card for the zone.  There are two Travel Insurance cards, which are 'wild' and can be used on any zone when you don't have the required zone card to play.  The rest are Golden Travel cards - you need these to win the game.

Quick Summary
The players travel in different zones.  They are rewarded for successful trips and penalised for unsuccessful ones.  Travelling a zone is done by placing down cards of the same zone (colour), beginning with a low number and ending with a high one (up to ten).  Travel Guide and Travel Insurance cards can be used to gain extra points but they must be played at the beginning of a trip.  Players can go on more than one trip.

The standard game is played by two people.  There are extra rules for four players (two teams).

Name: 川中島 (Kawanakajima)
Description:
KAWANAKAJIMAï¼ˆå·ä¸­å³¶) is Japanese historical war game.

The Battle of Kawanakajima lasted from 1553 to 1564.

It is a War Game that reproduces a total of 5 battles in 5 game turns.

Players compete for victory based on the total number of area-dominated victory points that they check each turn.

This game is included in "WARGAME HANDBOOK 2019".

Name: Fired Up: The Agility Expansion
Description:
The expansion includes 2 more exciting Fighters that can completely change the game with their speed.

Add Keane the Hurricane and Yabai the Scarlet Fiend, each with a unique ability related to speed.

Name: Fired Up: The Monster Expansion
Description:
The second expansion for Fired Up! features 4 new fighters, chosen by our Kickstarter backers!
4 unique monsters are entering the arena, each with its own ability capable of changing everything in the game. You can now try to influence Fenrir, the lava breathing werewolf, Hoppy, the 2 headed clown, Grantelith the Void Seeker and the illustrator of the game itself, The Mico.
Included are 10 more Highlight cards that can influence the whole game.

Name: Stap voor stap
Description:
In this game all players are working together in search for a solution to a social, health, animal or environmental problem.

One player (the know-all) is given a problem and can choose a fitting solution from 25 cards  laid out on the table in a 5x5 grid. The other players (detectives) should find this one card from the possibilities by eliminating cards based on hints given by the know-all. Hints are given based on color, shape, size, whisper, depiction or drawing on the back of a detective.

If the detectives eliminate all but the solution card, they win the game. If the solution card is eliminated, they lose.
Families: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

Name: Guardians of the City II
Description:
An educational card game meant to teach players the value of community support in protecting their communities against threats.

Two players face off against each other, drawing and playing cards from their identical decks.  Their goal is to resolve the crisis they are each facing, or to have deployed the most defense cards by the time both decks run out.  The resolution of a crisis requires a certain combination of defense cards to be played.

Players can also play event cards to hinder their opponent's progress.  Community support cards can be played to allow the play of other cards or boost their effectiveness; they also can protect against certain event cards.

Contents:-
2 identical sets of:

     2 Rules cards
     12 Event cards
     4 Community Support cards
     5 Digital Defence cards
     5 Psychological Defence cards
     5 Social Defence cards
     5 Economic Defence cards
     5 Civil Defence cards
     5 Military Defence cards
     6 Crisis cards

Name: Coalitions
Description:
Coalitions is based on the series of conflicts known as the Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars. Players, representing major European powers, compete against each other to shape the future of the Continent. The innovative and elegant game system allows a historical recreation of the conflicts, but better yet, can also create plausible alternative histories. The Alliances may take different forms, the campaigns may be fought along different lines of approach, but what the players witness is still a believable version of history.

Coalitions brings the whole continent of the Napoleonic Wars into a fast, playable system.  Multiplayers—with NO downtime. Each turn, EVERY player is doing something… but doing something ‘different.’  This sets up an unexpected cycle like nothing you’ve ever played before.  Cool wooden pieces, or a “Deluxe” version with some of the most beautiful miniatures you’ve ever seen. Kickstarter backers get exclusive sculpts, an extra player expansion, plus an extra game covering a slightly different period!

Throughout the period, Britain formed coalitions with almost any nation that would stand against France. Whenever a coalition was defeated, Britain sought to form a new one with states that would carry on the fight. Nations also had other motives to fight wars, often seeking to expand their own borders at the cost of their neighbors. Britain itself fought the French in Portugal and Spain and, with almost total control of the sea, sent military expeditions wherever there was a chance of harassing the French. Can the Emperor of Austria protect the German Reich and Northern Italy from the Revolutionary Armies? Will the Prussian King and Russian Tsarina join as allies or not? Will the Ottoman Empire be able to protect Egypt, the Balkans and Caucasus from the aggressive neighbors?

When you play Coalitions, you decide the destiny of Europe; your decisions will make history. Will you guide France to greatness? Will you galvanize and unite Europe to bring an end to the infant republic and restore the Ancien Régime? Or maybe there is a Metternich in you, able to deceive others and bluff your way to victory with a cunning smile?

Each player controls one of six asymmetric factions: France, England, Austria, Prussia, Russia or Turkey. They then try to form an alliance, insisting that it will be beneficial to all, although only one player can actually win. Throughout the game, players try to capture and consolidate key positions, which will earn victory points during the relevant phase.

—description from publisher

Name: Citytrip Junior
Description:
As a tour guide in Theme City you want to create the most memorable trip by visiting exciting attractions, wonderfull shops, wild animals, restaurants and more.

Citytrip Junior is a flip & write game that is quick to setup and easy to play. With a basic and advanced scoresheet, 15 starting points and 30 different missions, no 2 games will feel the same!

One player flips the upper card of the action stack. Simultaneously everybody chooses 2 actions that are horizontally or vertically adjacent (=7 possible combinations). Each player creates a road and circles achieved goals which give points on the scoresheet. The game ends when the action stack is empty. The player with the highest rating wins Citytrip Junior.

-description from publisher

Name: EXIT Challenge: Wettlauf gegen die Zeit
Description:
Alone or in a team with up to 6 players - age-appropriate puzzles have to be solved, strategic thinking and logical conclusions to be drawn. Put in the role of a special police unit, the motivated players set out in this Exit Challenge to catch the criminals who keep an entire city in suspense. The tricky puzzle fun takes between 45 and 90 minutes at the end of which many surprises await the other players. Thematically appropriate accessories, such as a code wheel or red filter, support you in completing the exciting tasks, and more than 70 puzzle, help and solution cards skilfully guide the player along the exciting narrative thread.

Alleine oder im Team mit bis zu 6 Mitspielern - es gilt altersgerechte Rätsel zu lösen, strategisch zu denken und logische Schlüsse zu ziehen. Versetzt in die Rolle einer Spezialeinheit der Polizei, machen sich die motivierten Spieler in dieser Exit Challenge auf, die Verbrecher zu fassen, die eine ganze Stadt in Atem halten. Zwischen 45 und 90 Minuten dauert der kniffelige Rätselspaß an dessen Ende so manche Überraschung auf die Mitspieler wartet. Thematisch passendes Zubehör, wie Coderad oder Rotfilter, unterstützen beim Bestehen der spannenden Aufgaben, mehr als 70 Rätsel-, Hilfe- und Lösungskarten führen die Spieler gekonnt entlang des aufregenden Erzählstrangs.

Name: EXIT Challenge: Notfall im Weltraum
Description:
Rätsel, Strategie und Logik erwarten die begeisterten Mitspieler – ob alleine oder im Team mit bis zu 6 Spielern. Als neue Besatzung der Raumstation ISS erleben die jungen Astronauten in dieser Exit Challenge den Nervenkitzel des Weltraums. Zwischen 45 und 90 Minuten dauert die Knobel-Unterhaltung bevor der Crew sprichwörtlich die Luft ausgeht. Passende Extras, wie Lochkarte oder Coderad, ergänzen die altersgerechten Rätsel thematisch passend, mehr als 65 Rätsel-, Hilfe- und Lösungskarten unterstützen beim schrittweisen Lösen der motivierenden Herausforderung.

Riddles, strategy and logic await the enthusiastic players - whether alone or in a team with up to 6 players. As the new crew of the ISS space station, the young astronauts experience the thrill of space in this Exit Challenge. The puzzle conversation lasts between 45 and 90 minutes before the crew literally runs out of air. Matching extras, such as punch cards or code wheels, complement the age-appropriate puzzles thematically, and more than 65 puzzle, help and solution cards support you in solving the motivating challenge step by step.

Name: The Art of War: Card Game
Description:
The Art of War: Card Game is a fantasy tabletop card game in which the player will lead one of four factions and challenge up to three opponents for the title Ruler of Midlands. The game can also be played in military alliance mode, where two alliances of two factions are fighting each other.

The Art of War: Card Game is a great classic card game suitable for playing with friends and family. One of the distinguishing features of this game is support for simultaneous play for up to four players. Simple rules will allow you to quickly get used to the game and play it without any additional means to keep track of game states. And the non-collectible aspect of the game will allow you to start playing it immediately after purchase, without wasting time and money looking for rare and expensive cards.

Name: Truffle Shuffle
Description:
Who will be crowned the Ultimate Sweet Tooth in this fast-thinking, fast-moving chocolate challenge?

Roll all three dice and race to be the player to spot the sugary treat that matches the combination of colors, and then grab it first! There will only ever be one exact match, so you’ll have to be super speedy to snatch up that sweet and claim victory!

The first player to get seven truffles wins the game.

Name: Jolly Polly
Description: A banana tree is shaking from the weight of the fruits and the parrots want to feast on them! Easier said than done as the tree does not stay still. Every time a new parrot lands on the tree, it shakes and moves. The first player to place all their parrots on the tree wins!

Name: Demon Castle Mononoke
Description:
Demon Castle Mononoke is a cooperative bluffing game where players take the role of heroes defending a cursed castle from bizarre spirits of Japanese legend. As night approaches over the castle, only one hero at a time can take watch and see the spirit approach. Only they know the spirit's strength and whether it is friend or foe, and it's up to them to rally their allies... or lead them to their own destruction.

Using a unique real-time simultaneous combat mechanic and partial information about your enemies, Demon Castle Mononoke is a parable about trust and teamwork. If the castle falls, no player can win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Romandie
Description:
The Tour de Romandie is a Helvetian event with a mountainous route.

Switzerland offers an ideal course for the game with the Tour of Romandy.

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: Hecata Expansion Pack
Description:
1 Double Sided Tile
1 Character Board & Sheet
1 40mm Miniature
30+ Cards & Tokens
2 Playable Scenarios

Name: Magnytour Profil: Tour de Pologne
Description:
The Tour of Poland is a very mountainous and very nervous event.

Because it is very mountainous, the Tour of Poland gives you the opportunity to explode the peloton.

Name: Tsukuyumi: Sunrise Kingdom
Description:
Time has passed and the Sun Goddess Amateraus, Tsukuyumi's sister, intervenes to save her creation. She opens the portals of ancient times and sends the Guardians to assist the living beings of the world. Sunrise Kingdom is set in the southern hemisphere where Australia once was. Here you are further away from the moon, but peace does not reign here either. Surviving factions fight for resources, habitat and against the Oni onslaught.
This is a 1000 copies limited edition standee version of the latest expansion for Tsukuyumi - Full Moon Down. This box contains 5 all-new factions: The First Guardians, Circle of the Sun, Sisters of Seven, Moon Circus and the Reef Collective.

Also included: a completely new game mode without a central moon: instead, you use portals to move across the map at lightning speed, while three powerful Guardians support you in your fight against the Oni. Each Guardian comes with a special supernatural power and changes the way they can be moved and used. This game mode can be played with all factions, including those from previous expansions and the base box.

The game comes with a new territory type: Amaterasu - territories that may not be conquered by Oni.

All factions come with cards for the 2-player mode, as well as the ever-popular faction events and their mascotts, and as always are fully compatible with all previous factions. To play with 2 players, the 2-player expansion is required. To play with 6 players, the After the Moonfall expansion ist required.

—description from the publisher

Zeit ist vergangen und die Sonnengöttin Amateraus, Tsukuyumis Schwester, greift ein, um ihre Schöpfung zu retten. Sie öffnet die Portale der alten Zeit und entsendet die Guardians, um den Lebewesen der Welt beizustehen. Sunrise Kingdom spielt auf der Südhalbkugel wo sich einst Australien befand. Hier ist man weiter vom Mond weg, aber Frieden herrscht auch hier nicht. Überlebende Fraktionen kämpfen auch hier um Ressourcen, Lebensraum und gegen den Ansturm der Oni.
1000 Stück limitierte Standee Version der neuesten Erweiterung für Tsukuyumi - Full Moon Down. In dieser Box befinden sich 5 gänzlich neue Fraktionen: The First Guardians, Circle of the Sun, Sisters of Seven, Moon Circus und das Korallen-Kollektiv.
Außerdem enthalten: ein komplett neuer Spielmodus ohne zentralen Mond: stattdessen könnt ihr euch mit Portalen blitzschnell über die Karte bewegen, während drei mächtige Guardians euch in eurem Kampf gegen die Oni unterstützen. Jeder Guardian kommt mit einer besonderen übernatürlichen Kraft und verändert die Art wie er bewegt und eingesetzt werden kann. Dieser Spielmodus kann mit allen Fraktionen, auch denen aus vorangegangenen Expansions und der Grundbox, gespielt werden.
Das Spiel kommt mit einem neuen Gebietstyp: Amaterasu - Gebiete die nicht von Oni erobert werden dürfen.

Alle Fraktionen kommen mit Karten für den 2-Spielermodus, sowie die allseits beliebten Fraktionsereignissen und ihren Maskottchen und sind wie immer voll kompatibel mit allen bisherigen Fraktionen. Für das Spiel zu zweit wird die 2-Spieler Erweiterung benötigt. Für 6 Spieler wird die After the Moonfall Erweiterung benötigt.

—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Tsukuyumi: Chronomasters
Description:
The Chronomasters are 12 time-traveling apes who return from the future to save the Earth from disaster. This faction, similar to the Sentinels is a game changer faction that will definitely turn the usual game concepts upside down. Using time travel markers, they can protect their territories in a very special way and use their time paradox attack to teleport entire armies back to their home territory - as if they had never left. Be surprised how the Chronomasters bring exciting new ideas to the game, while adding and changing the game in the usual Tsukuyumi manner.

As always, this faction is compatible with all previously released expansions and also includes cards for 2-player mode, 5 faction event cards and the ever-popular mascot.

Two years before the Moonfall, a spaceship with an experimental propulsion system was tested. Just six years later, this ship returned to Earth, with highly evolved apes aboard - the great-grandchildren of the six apes who had been trained to test the drive.
Three generations later, the ship that created the black hole - the source of the drive - again traveled through space and time and returned to Earth. The ship was now populated by 40 apes who had converted the ship into a large space ark. They will come back to Earth to save it from what lurks in the future. There is only a small window of time for this, as there is already a wreck of their ark on Earth under tons of sand.

The Chronomasters are here to protect the Earth from the future, equipped with high technology and the knowledge of things to come.

—description from the publisher

Die Chronomaster sind 12 zeitreisende Affen, die aus der Zukunft zurückkehren, um die Erde vor der Katastrophe zu retten. Diese Fraktion, ist ähnlich den Sentinels, eine Game Changer Fraktion, die durchaus die gewohnten Spielkonzepte auf den Kopf stellen wird. Über Zeitreisemarker können sie ihre Gebiete ganz besonders schützen und mit ihrem Zeitparadox-Angriff ganze Armeen in ihr Heimatgebiet zurückteleportieren - als wären sie nie losgelaufen. Lasst euch überraschen, wie die Chronomaster spannende neue Ideen in das Spiel bringen und dabei in gewohnter Tsukuyumi-Manier das Spiel ergänzen und verändern.

Diese Fraktion ist wie immer mit allen bisher erschienen Expansions kombinierbar und enthält auch Karten für den 2-Spielermodus, 5 Fraktionsereigniskarten und das allseits beliebte Maskottchen.

Zwei Jahre vor dem Mondfall wurde ein Raumschiff mit einem experimentellen Antrieb getestet. Nur sechs Jahre später kehrte dieses Schiff zur Erde zurück, an Bord hochentwickelte Affen - die Urenkel der sechs Affen, welche darauf trainiert worden waren, den Antrieb zu testen.
Drei Generationen später reiste das Schiff, welches das Schwarze Loch - die Quelle des Antriebs - erschaffen hatte erneut durch Raum und Zeit und kehrte zur Erde zurück. Das Schiff wurde nun von 40 Affen bevölkert, welche das Schiff in eine große Raumarche umgebaut hatten. Sie werden zurück auf die Erde kommen, um sie vor dem zu retten, was in der Zukunft lauert. Hierfür gibt es nur ein kleines Zeitfenster, da es auf der Erde unter Tonnen von Sand bereits ein Wrack ihrer Arche gibt.

Die Chronomaster sind hier um die Erde vor der Zukunft zu schützen, ausgestattet mit Hochtechnologie und dem Wissen über die Dinge, welche noch kommen werden.

—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Beyblade V-Force: Micro Tops Battling Game
Description:
Let It Rip!

Drop in your power cores and get ready to battle! Send your Micro Top spinning and knock the power cores into the goals. You get to keep all of your opponent's power cores that you capture in your goal. But your opponent can keep any of your that he/she has captured. Be the first one to collect ten of your opponent's power cores and you win!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Sea of Legends: Rise of the Ancients
Description:
This expansion nearly doubles the base game content! Giving 4 new captains to play as. As well as 4 new factions to play against. All can be played and mixed with base game captains and factions.

CAPTAINS 
Grimwald - Isn't letting a little curse get him down. This dead man doesn't have to worry about dying again.

Jack - Rules her ship with steel and spit. She's the type to stab first and ask questions later. Nobody is getting the jump on her!

Matchlock - Always brings his guns to a knife fight, or a sword fight, or any type of fight for that matter. And he's just itching for trouble. Or maybe that's fleas?

Liu - Has a short fuse and a real knack for blowing things up, especially her enemies. Turns out, cannonballs are a girl's best friend.

FACTIONS
Ordo of Nocturnus - sends their initiates to infiltrate the ports, establishing secret cults. Once they have five in place, they summon their demon-prince, Nocturne.

Aztec Reawakening - players will receive a cursed Aztec coin whenever they’d gain 5 or more gold at one time. These coins have negative effects similar to Nemesis abilities.

Sea’s Fury - the coven of sea witches believes all pirates are guilty of stealing their relics. The Spirit of Vengeance summons Sea Elementals that will try to sneak aboard your ship and take relics back.

Harpy’s Descent - the player with the most Notoriety will get a Hunted token, the Harpy chases down that player.

Name: Micro Mariners
Description:
Welcome, researchers!
 An unusually high amount of rare marine life has been spotted in a nearby cove. Whether you are an amateur or an expert diver, you cannot pass up the chance to research these amazing creatures. Make new discoveries to gain points, but don’t be naive, many of these creatures still pose a threat to those who wander too carelessly into their home!


Contents

     8 Amateur Diver Tokens
     8 Expert Tokens
     2 Dice
     16 Creature Cards
     1 Rules Card
     1 Research Vessel / Reference Card



How to Play

SETUP - Place the Research Vessel (RV) card to the side of the playing area. Spread the remaining cards face-down. Each player receives either the Red & Gold, or Blue & Silver set of diver tokens. Gold & Silver are experts, and let you adjust your dice roll by +/-1 on the turn they are added to a card.

ON YOUR TURN - The lowest dice roll goes first. Place 2 amateurs or 1 expert token on any face-down card (or face-up card that you control) per turn. Roll both dice. If either dice matches the back of the card, flip it and place your token on a free square. If the roll total matches any face-up cards with your diver on them, take the action shown and end your turn.

DISCOVERIES - Each player may have a diver on a card back, however only the player who discovers it may add their tokens once the card flips. The losing player’s token is returned to them. If you place divers on all available spaces on a card, on your next turn you may take the card as a Discovery Point, and retrieve your divers.

INJURIES & ACCIDENTS - Dangerous creatures can injure your divers and send them to the RV. Once ‘healed’ after 3 turns for injuries, or 1 for accidents, they can be placed again.

HOW TO WIN - Collect 8 Discovery Points to win. Deduct 1 point for each diver still in recovery at the end of the game.

Name: Monster's Castle
Description:
In "The Monster's Castle", players (monsters) race to be the first to  arrive at the end of the gameboard track and "rent" the last remaining castle on the block. But can they avoid the traps and the double traps as they each race to reach their new home?

A colorful but simple spin and move game, this is one of five similar titles from Warren publications (best known for publishing the Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella magazines of the mid 70's).

This game appeared in the "Famous Monsters of Filmland" magazine issue #106 (April 1974) and was also offered as part of a separate 5 game mail-order bundle (#2661 for $2.50) from Warren magazines  - the bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle, all of which were printed from '73 to '74 on thin glossy magazine cover stock paper. Unlike the other four games which were credited to Bill DuBay, this one is credited to W.R. Mohalley.

Name: Le grand Tour du Monde
Description:
With Le grand Tour du Monde Discover 232 destinations around the world, their must-see sites, the best season to go there, anecdotes ...

Using the dice, go around the world answering as many questions as possible. 
Be careful, a trip always holds surprises!

The cards are illustrated with photos, 1000 questions divided by continent, various themes (culture and heritage, nature and landscapes, world cuisine, sports and adventures, practical advice)

Name: Jenga: Book Lovers Edition
Description: From the instructions in the box: The object is to remove one block at a time from the tower. Read and answer the question aloud that appears on the block and then stack it on top. The last player to stack a block without making the tower fall wins the game. The most avid reader assembles the tower and then goes first. Play passes to the left. On your turn, carefully remove one block from anywhere below the highest completed story of the tower. Use only one hand. Then stack the block on top of the tower at right angles to the blocks just below it. As the block is removed, read the question on it out loud. Answer the question and let the conversation flow as you stack the block on top of the tower. You can touch blocks to find a loose one, but if you move a block out of place, you must put it back in place using one hand only before touching another block. While stacking, always complete a 3-block story before starting a higher one. Your turn ends 10 seconds after you stack your block or as soon as the next player touches one.

Name: Jenga: The Walking Dead Edition
Description:
This is The Walking Dead edition of the Jenga classic block stacking game.

Players remove and stack custom blocks, with game-changing actions.

(Back of the box)

Name: Alien Frenzy
Description:
At just 103,027,000,000,000kms from Earth and orbiting a tiny little star in the constellation Virgo is a planet we call Ross 128b. The rest of the galaxy however know it as Sorr, named after the Sorras who today became the first Alien civilisation to make direct contact with Earth. In an ominous and undoubtedly mocking tone, their message, 'The Sorras are approaching. Your planet we are poaching.' immediately caused people to wonder if the rhyme was intentional, or just a lucky coincidence. Seconds later it plunged the world into chaos.
 When will they arrive? What do they want? Will they ever leave? No one knows. One thing's for certain though, they're not just coming for a cup of space tea.

Alien Frenzy is a wildly chaotic and suspenseful card game that plunges players head first into an Alien Invasion. The game unfolds in two thrilling phases with game play designed for 2-4 players.

The game begins in the Preparation phase, before the Aliens have invaded. Here, players take turns playing and drawing cards to improve their hand and mess with opponents. However, the tension builds as players desperately try to avoid drawing a dreaded UFO card, as this triggers the Invasion, and places that unlucky player at the forefront of the action.

During the Invasion phase, players take turns playing cards, and revealing Invasion cards. Here players come face to face with the Aliens and must fend off their attacks with Character cards. Once a player has no Character cards left, they are eliminated from the game.

Who will be the last player standing amidst the frenzy of the Alien Invasion? Only the most strategic and resilient will emerge victorious.

—description from the designer

Name: Air Master
Description:
Win in one turn at any time. You’re never out of it. Features a novel scoring system.

Air Master is a unique Push Your Luck game, where you fly your way to victory by navigating favourable winds.

But catch the bad ones, and make no progress, or even be blown backwards!

Note the ones that work and find the easy routes to lift the SAVVY crown.

Occasionally during the game, strong headwinds occur, and any gains are lost.

In the final rounds, tropical storms can wreak havoc, and force you further back from where you started.

You have options though, of sitting out potential storms by backtracking, and waiting for it to pass. Or to backtrack at certain stages, and check out alternative flight paths.

You can see the wind strengths you face at each moment of your turn, represented by numbered playing cards.

Taken into consideration with the accompanying wind chart, which shows which cards have already been played, you can see before you call, the success of any choice you make.

The combination of chart and numbered cards make it a very exceptional, and accurate weather forecasting mechanic. Outcomes are based on known probability before you make a call and not random luck.

After each successful forecast, you can call again, and your plane can keep moving forward. However, you must judge when it’s time to bring that part of the journey to an end, as a subsequent wrong weather call will blow you off-course, and lose the progress you have just made.

Misjudging the weather for first calls on turns in the closing stages, equivalent to heavy storms will force your plane back, up to five rows from original starting positions.

There are also random squall areas where you must backtrack a row if wanting to shelter.

Being in the lead is not a given for success. Your progress is never certain, planes can go forwards, and backwards too. Any player can go on a run at anytime and win the game in one turn.

Due to the high average call success rate, (over 75%), it’s very easy to rack up quick points, but you have to put your main focus on when to stop and bank those gains.

Air Master is a non-confrontational game, apart from tactically leaving difficult weather cards for the next player to deal with. However, you are still competing against each other to hit the winning line first. Risks have to be taken, but when?

This is a simple game with odds judgement that will tax even the brightest minds, and levels of addiction that compel you to get involved with other player decisions.

You may find yourself encouraging players to go for it, when really you want them to blow out and drop points. Oh there’s humour alright.

But when the same players then go on long winning runs, you actually want them to succeed. There’s a natural impulse to take interest in other players turns.

Then there’s your playing style. Are you an odds calculator who plays the  percentages?

(If you’re into maths and probability, this is right up your street, and you will find good methods of play).

Or are you an instinct player who gets the feel of the cards and plays accordingly?

(Sometimes you’ll see a lopsided number chart, and know a change is coming).

Or never mind all that, you feel lucky and call whatever comes into your head; it's your day right?

( Only when all the luck is with you!)

Or should you play a mix of all three?

Air Master is a game where you sometimes have to step outside your comfort zone, no matter what your base impulses are. 
Have you got the nerve to go against your natural instincts if it may win you the game?

So  back to the game, do you play, or pass and give the next player something to think about? No thanks there!

Get it wrong and there are penalties. Get it right and you’re on a roll.

Correct calls win points. Fifteen will win it. You can be nearly there, and then start dropping back.

Can you handle the sympathy?

Then there is the fantastic help from your fellow players.

If you want to follow it, dream on – you’re in the wrong game.

Banter has no boundaries here, and some of the advice on offer would make your progress very backward indeed.

Sometimes you will remember a game for the laughs you had, the winner is irrelevant,  well nearly. That’s how game sessions go.

Lots of humour and constant dilemmas. ‘’Air Master’’is a one-off rollercoaster.

For 1-6 players, aged 8 and upwards, and a playing time of 30-60 minutes.

The solo mode is limited by the number of plays through the deck. Ten minute playing time.

All age groups can understand the easy game mechanics, and many game plans can be devised, from simple hunch and feel, to varying degrees of mathematical strategies.

Experienced pilots judge the moments well, win more and earn the SAVVY crown.

Components: Game board, number chart, Duo board, 36 playing cards, 6 planes, 6 position markers, 1 squall disc, 1 crown, 35 markers.
1-6 players, 8+, 30-60 mins.

Rules:

Setup: Look through the cards and note the first number from 10 to 14. Place the blue squall disc on this same number on the game board.

Place a plane and position marker on the zero row for each player.

Place the SAVVY crown on the Win row.

Shuffle the cards and put one card aside face down. Lay the deck face down and turn over the top card and place beside it. Cover this number on the chart using the green marker.

(When the deck is depleted during the game, shuffle all the cards, including the card put aside, except the last turned up card, which becomes the new starting point).

How to Play: Choose a player to make first call as to whether the next card is higher or lower. There is a smoother game flow experience if one player manages the cards.

Choose a player to manage the number chart.

After each successful call, move the marker one row forward. If you then make an incorrect call, the marker  is returned to the plane, and no progress has been made.

After successful consecutive calls, you may choose to stop, and move the plane forward to join the marker.

After unsuccessful calls, the turn is ended, and play moves clockwise.

Rows 0-3:

You may call again after an incorrect first call, one Free Go per turn.

You may pass your turn on rows 1-3 without penalty.

Rows 4-9:
  
At the start of your turn, before calling, you may choose to change the top card. However, move your plane and marker back a row.

You mass your turn without penalty.

(If you change the top card and then pass, you will have moved back one row).


Rows 10-14:

If you make an incorrect first call, move your plane and marker back to row 9.

You may choose to change the top card but move your plane and marker back a row.

You may pass on your turn but move your plane and marker back a row.

(If you change the top card and then pass, you will have moved back two rows).

If you change the top card and then make an incorrect first call, you move back to row 9.

Blue disc: This represent a squall. If you elect to stop when on one of these rows, you move back a row.

If you want to pass or change the top card, and that action puts your plane back to a blue row, you move back another row.

The first player to reach the Win area claims the SAVVY crown.

—description from the designer

Name: Cavaletti: Le jeu des clubs houses
Description:
Cavaletti is designed to review all levels thanks to its 1,100 questions and answers.


     It simulates a CSO course (show jumping course). 
     The hexagonal boxes allow players to follow realistic curves. 
     All types of obstacles (oxer, wall, spa, vertical, bidet) are available. 
     The first direction of the obstacle is specified (16 obstacles available). 
     Rejections, bars and take options can happen.
     It is possible to play only with the cards and the booklet as a trivia game.


Goal: 

     choose a course (among 6 on the board) corresponding to the length of the game you want and
     be the first rider to cross the finish line. 


Gameplay:
Players move in strides (with the dice) and answer questions (depending on their level, G1-G7) to re-roll or not. 
Be careful, if the horse stops on the take-off square or on the obstacle, he has made a refusal or a bar. The rider can get by by answering two questions instead of just one.

Name: Plunder Busters
Description:
Plunder Busters is a board game for 3-4 players, where each player takes the role of a budding archaeologist trying to achieve glory in their field. They will do this by exploring new excavation sites, digging up artefacts and researching new relics.

In Phase 1 (Build your Dig Site!), players will place tiles on their Dig Site board in secret before embarking on Phase 2 (Plunder!); where players will explore each others’ Dig Sites, attempting to claim Relics and Artefacts whilst avoiding the Traps set by the other players.

Players will earn Reputation by uncovering tiles which contain Artefacts (worth 1, 2 or 3 points), or prized Relics (worth 4+ points); the locations of which are indicated by 'clue' cards that players will compete to collect. However, following false leads and uncovering a Trap tile will cause a player to lose Reputation (-5 points) at the hands of devious opponents. The adventurer with the highest Reputation when the available clue cards have been exhausted will win the game!

The game begins as a tile-laying/’build your own board’ adventure, before shifting to an exploration of your opponents’ dig sites: through the cunning use of action cards and a quest to find hidden Relics, only the most successful adventurer will prevail!

-description from designer

Name: Tilty
Description:
The objective of the game is to add items to Tilty the clown without having him tip.

Before playing, assemble Tilty the clown and put him in the middle of the table. The first player spins the spinner and chooses an object of the color he/she spun and places it either on Tilty or one of the three trays he is balancing. Only one hand may be used to perform this action and Tilty cannot be touched.

When a player tries to place an object on Tilty and it or others fall off, that player is eliminated. The objects that fell are put back into play. The last player left is the winner.

Name: Breakaway: The Anti-Violence Anti-Aggression Anti-Anger Anti-Abuse Game
Description:
This is an educational game to teach adolescents about abuse and nonviolent ways to handle anger.

Players go around a circular track landing on either Breakaway or Aggression spaces.

The first to reach the top of the freedom path wins.

Name: Beyblade Burst Rise Hypersphere Vertical Drop Battle Set
Description:
Drop in to victory with Beyblade Burst Rise Hypersphere tech! Hypersphere Vertical Drop Beystadium consists of 3 sections specially designed for exciting Beyblade Burst battles. Climb the vertical wall of the Beystadium to reach the brink and gain an edge over your contenders. Then, speed along the brink and drop in to the battle ring for head-to-head collisions. Get the drop on your opponents for exciting, high-intensity battles!

Includes everything needed to battle: Beyblade Burst Hypersphere Vertical Drop Beystadium, 2 right/left-spin Beyblade Burst launchers and 2 Hypersphere battling tops with GT Chips.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Monumentus
Description:
Monumentus is a two to four player combination territory control and resource management game played on triangular tiles, with the ability to expand to 5-8 players. Roleplaying as the mangers of a civilization, players make progress across an advancement track split into four eras of time, with each era requiring a player to construct four unique buildings which either produce resources, create an engine to produce new resources, or effect the way in which those resources are managed.

At the beginning of the game, each player is given eight terrain tiles, two of which are placed at the start of the game. As each player advances to the next era, they place two new terrain tiles creating a sort of "fog of war". Over the course of gameplay each player will place 16 buildings before constructing the final monument, winning the game for that player.

In addition to the placement of buildings, each turn players draw either a "rise" or a "ruin" card depending on their leaderboard position. These cards have random effects which balance gameplay for those who are lagging behind or have snowballed ahead, which can be omitted for purely strategic gameplay. As well, players move up to two merchant pieces with the ability to duplicate the production of the building or resource triangle they are standing on, including the buildings of their opponents.

At the end of each round, players collectively take part in open trade where they are able to trade: resources, constructed buildings, rise cards, their status tokens, and can make promissory agreements for future payment which they are not required to fulfil. The game is played until the first player constructs their monument, which determines the winner of that game. The game can be continued to determined second, third, place players if desired.

—description from the designer

Name: Cold War 3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990: 4th Edition
Description:
Fully revised 4th Edition of COLD WAR3! 

Includes:

     Rules for combined arms using artillery, armour, mechanised, aircraft and support troops (such as engineers and medical personnel).
     Rules for the electronic battlefield, nuclear, biological & chemical battlefield.
     Recovering and repairing 'knocked out' vehicles; building bridges, defenses, trenches and repairing defenses.
     Fighting in buildings, built up areas and in a contaminated environment.
     Rules for paratroopers, reconnaissance elements, assaults and close-combat (even assaulting tanks if you are so inclined).
     Rules for conducting air support missions, air-to-air combat, air-to-ground attacks, helicopter operations, anti-aircraft artillery and missiles.
     Rules are also included for morale and their effect on our little model soldiers. Wounds and recovery of those (using medics if you've paid for them!)
     Rules for various armours such as Chobham, Dorchester, ERA bricks, BAR armour and all manner of nasties thsat can defeat those armours including 2nd generation (Top-Attack.Tandem Warhead) ATGM's such as Improved TOW II and the Russian Svir missiles. 
     This new version includes the following New TO&E's:
         A complete BAOR (British Army of the Rhine)/NORTHTAG battlegroup for the 14th/20th Royal Hussars and Royal Green Jackets; including Chieftain Mk.V Tanks, Fv432 APC, Abbot and M-109 Self-Propelled Guns, RAMC Medical Teams, 9th/12th Lancers Reccee Teams (in Scorpion AFV), Swingfire ATGM, Blowpipe and Rapier SAM and 661st Squadron Army Air Corps in Lynx HELARM and the Royal Air Force with shiny Harrier GR.III and Lightning Ground Attack Aircraft.
         Soviet Forces: 3rd Shock Armies 10th Guards Armoured Divisions: with T80u and T-64bv tanks, BMP-1 and BMP-2 APC's, BTR-70's and of course a whole plethora of artillery such as the BM-21, BM-27, 2s1 and 2s3 artillery, anti-aircraft artillery such as the Tunguska, ZSU-23-4 and the ZSU-23-2 AA guns, the Soviet Air Force flying Su-25 Frogfoots and even Mil-Mi-8 Hip attack helicopters!
    


Also includes all new color photographs and illustrations.

-description from publisher

Name: Fantasy Delight
Description:
Two consenting adult players will compete to be the first to enter the Danger Zone... err... make that "the Delight Zone" at the center of the game board, where the roll of a dice will determine which of 11 scenarios will be enacted (with the winner in charge of the ensuing role-played action). Costumes are optional but highly recommended per the scenario booklet. Especially if you get the alien encounter scenario.

Along the way to the center, various diverting tasks must be performed as you roll the dice and land on squares that give you things to do, including a moment where you stop and "select a new first and last name" to use later during role play. I suggest using "Richard Nixon", but mileage may vary.

Bonus points - this adult board game for partners includes some screamingly bad/unintentionally funny artwork, but clearly was a labor of someone's love. Good luck finding a copy (or wanting to)!

Name: Agrarian
Description:
Agrarian is an economic farming game in which farmers go through a land bidding phase and then followed by a growing stage. During the bidding phase, different parcels of land will come up for auction in which all the farmers will put in a blind bid on each parcel of land. The highest bid gets the land.

During the second phase, farmers get a weather prediction and then have to decide what crops to grow. The more of one crop the group as a whole grows the less valuable it becomes. Weather also affects each crop differently. Once farmers decide what crops they are growing, the weather is decided by a dice roll that affects all farmers equally. Then crops are revealed and the value of the crops are adjusted based on the number of fields grown.

Farmers collect the amount of money they have made for each crop and then start the second round. 3 rounds later the game ends and the farmer with the most money wins.

-description from designer

Name: Dice in the Darkness
Description:
Your dog has been taken captive deep into the dungeon by a mysterious creature. Fight your way through the ten rooms to save your dog and defeat the monster that is stealing joy from so many.

Dice in the Darkness is an episodic roll-and-write adventure played over ten rooms. You choose a character, Wizard, Warrior, or Rogue, and play that character through this ten room dungeon, upgrading and unlocking new abilities, with each room being a unique, one page roll-and-write experience.

It will be a free play-along-adventure, with each new room premiering via Twitch each week for ten weeks. Grab your pen, paper, and dice and survive the dungeon to save your beloved dog!

—description from the designer

Name: Wetmore Forest: Picture Pairing Game
Description:
Use your memory and search the forest for monsters that match the pictures on the cards. But be careful - if you draw a Scramble card, all the monsters will find new hiding spots!

On each player's turn, they turn over two tokens and try to match the creatures to any of the three cards available that turn. If they get a match, they take both the token and the card, then reveal more cards until there are three creature cards. If a Scramble card is draw, the tokens are randomized and play resumes as normal. Whoever gets the most tokens and cards wins the game!

Name: Pitch&Plakks: Battle Mode expansion
Description:
Pitch&Plakks: Battle Mode expansion adds four new components and the ability to play one-on-one simultaneous games via the Triple.  Can be played as a standalone version (using the same rules as the basic game) or with the basic game.

In Battle Mode, both players start at the same time. The player nearest the hole, plays again. Then players alternate until one reaches the hole.

New components added:


    1x Triple (for Battle Mode)
    1x Volcano
    1x Bridge
    1x Jump

Name: Star Travelers: The Game
Description:
A full rework of the original Star Travelers game, including a new starting board, more player interactivity, and less space punishment!

Players begin the game with a pass-draft to recruit crew members and upgraded ship parts. You will then set out into space in one of twelve directions, revealing tiles by using your ship's radar to discover planets, face aliens, and encounter random events along the way. Throughout the game, your actions will earn you rank marks that will determine the winner. Played on a modular board that is built as you play, Star Travelers combines classic mechanics with modern, modular components to keep game play fresh every time you play. Based on the sci-fi book series by author K. E. Knights.

—description from the publisher

Name: Millennium Blades: Crossovers 2 Mini-Expansion
Description:
Millennium Blades: Promo Pack #7 consists of new cards sets based on boardgame characters from a bunch of pretty awesome companies.

Contains sets based on

Burgle Bros.
AEGIS
Kamigami Battles
Dice Thrones
Near and Far
Doomtown Reloaded

Name: Millennium Blades: Crossovers 3 Mini-Expansion
Description:
Millennium Blades: Promo Pack #8 consists of new cards sets based on boardgame characters from a bunch of pretty awesome companies.

Contains sets based on

Gruff
Street Masters
The Red Dragon Inn
Middara
Kill the Overlord
Monolith Arena

Name: Millennium Blades: Co-Op Bosses Mini-Expansion
Description: Millennium Blades: Promo Pack #9 consists of three new Bosses to join forces against, or play against them solo.

Name: Millennium Blades: Extra Characters Mini-Expansion
Description:
Millennium Blades: Promo Pack #10 consists of three new characters that make you look at the game in brand new ways.

Contains
Exaltius the Unbeatable Extra Character
Mysterious Alien F Extra Character
Aaron G Extra Character
Mysterious Expansion Set for Aaron G

Name: Millennium Blades: Extra Sets Mini-Expansion
Description:
Millennium Blades: Promo Pack #11 consists of a variety of new sets with different themes.

Contains the following sets

Crafting Country Expansion Set
Princess Power Expansion Set
The Accessory Strikes Back Premium Set
Fast 3 Master Set

Name: Millennium Blades: Finaler Bosses Mini-Expansion
Description:
Millennium Blades: Promo Pack #12 consists of card sets based on the three cooperative scenario battles in Mini-Expansion 9.

Contains the following sets
Future Proof Expansion Set
World Warriors Premium Set
Realm of Shadows Master Set
Extra Core Set Accessories

Name: Conquer
Description:
The game board is similar to Ludo with four bases and a cross-shaped playspace.

Capturing is done when a player's piece lands exactly on a space occupied by an opponent's piece. The player's piece then moves together with the opponent's piece and brings it back to base. The capture is then complete.

If a player lands on a space occupied by an opponent with a captured piece, he may capture the opponent and set the captured piece free. There are green safety spaces on the board where pieces cannot be captured.

The game ends when all of one player's pieces are captured. The player with the most captured pieces wins.

—user summary

Name: Spielbox-Almanach 25 Jahre Hans im Glück Beilage
Description:
This punchboard which was sold with the spielbox-Almanach "25 Jahre Hans im Glück" contains five tiles for Carcassonne (old design) Carcassonne: The Cult and six tiles for Stone Age (Stone Age: The New Huts).
.

Name: Carcassonne: Spiel Doch! Expansion
Description:
Issue 2/2018 (autumn/winter 2018) of the German boardgame magazine SPIEL DOCH! published in September 2018 contained a punchboard with 4 tiles: 2 for Carcassonne and 2 for Carcassonne: Safari

This entry is for the 2 Carcassonne tiles using the artwork for the more recent printings.

One tile shows a donkey stable and the other a garden for the Abbott. You can use these tiles to play the variant where the player who manages to place the two new tiles in the correct order immediately receives five extra points.

Name: Carcassonne: Safari – Spiel Doch! Expansion
Description:
Issue 2/2018 (autumn/winter 2018) of the german boardgame magazine SPIEL DOCH! published in september 2018 contained a punchboard with 4 tiles: 2 for Carcassonne and 2 for Carcassonne: Safari

This entry is for the 2 Carcassonne: Safari tiles.

One shows an elephant/lion and the other a zebra/giraffe.

Name: Artefact
Description:
Artefact is a story game for one player, designed for contemplative solo play.

In the classic dungeon crawl, you follow the lives of adventurers as they overcome challenges to gain prestige and, most importantly, magical treasures. But what were those treasures doing before the adventurers came along? How many aeons have passed, in silent darkness, since they were last used?

Artefact shifts the focus to the perspective of a single magical item, and its history as it passes through the hands of many different keepers. You’ll feel the weight of time as the item is lost or abandoned again and again, the dust & decay piling around it until it’s found again by someone new.

It's a great way to spend an hour; sketching, world-building and storytelling in your own company. It's also a fantastic way to generate really unique items for tabletop games like D&D, with detailed histories far more vivid than any you'd typically find in a compendium.

Name: Mustachio
Description:
COME and Join this amazing trick taking game of strategy, quick wits, bidding, and point winning! Great for teamwork and strategizing with a team to be the boldest and most devious Nut on the planet!
Know your Cards! Some cards have points, some have tricks, and some have powers!

Name: Monopoly: Croatia
Description:
The goal of the game is to buy property, rent it, resell it, gain as much money as possible and by the end of the game become the only player on the board.

The Monopoly Croatia lets you buy Zagreb sights (the building of the Croatian National Theater and the Museum of Arts and Crafts), Pula Arena, the enchanting islands of Hvar and Brac, the Plitvice lakes, baroque VaraÅ¾din, Dubrovnik, Rovinj, Rijeka...

Name: Le jeu des petits cyclistes
Description:
With Le jeu des petits cyclistes, the Little Cyclists game, simulate all the biggest races of the season (Tour de France, Paris-Roubaix, world championships, etc...). 
Retrieve the specificities of the peloton, mountain passes or cobbled sectors. 
Attack (like Pierre Rolland!), Suck the wheel… 
adopt the right strategy to achieve victory!

—description from back of the box (translated)

A simplified version of Um Reifenbreite.

Name: Gü
Description:
The Güs are experts on plants and they have given funny names to each full with the letter ü. They have created secret recipes, with different ingredients for each plant to heal them. These can not be mixed up! Only the appropriate combination of crystals can help with the messy sprouts and the rashes, too. The healing crystals must be collected on certain clearings in the forest. But the trees are in continuous motion, the entrances of the clearings are changing their place, which can make the Güs job easier or harder. The movement can also lead to
unexpected meetings with forest creatures.

The aim of the game is to collect the correct color combinations and help as many plants as
you can during the game. The player who collects the most recipe cards and heals the most plants
is the winner.

The game ends when there are no recipe cards left. The player who collected the most recipe
cards and healed the most plants is the winner. If there is an equal number of recipe cards then it’s
a tie, you are both equally good healers!

Name: The Generic Gangster Chase Game
Description:
An independent publication from 1981, this umpired two-player game features two indoor "chases," one set in an office building and one in a warehouse.

The basic theme of each scenario is that Big Jim, a mob hitman, is seeking to rub out ace reporter Ace Wilson.

This is a refereed tactical, man-to-man scale game. In this case the game scale is literal, in that each of the two players only has one counter. The actions a player can take include listening, moving, and fighting -- although only Big Jim has a gun, which Ace tries to offset with his greater speed.

It's film noir action, in the form of seven counters and an 8.5x11 map (backprinted, as each scenario uses its own map).

—user summary

Name: Sitz Krieg ohne Hass: Orders of Battle – Fall of France
Description:
Fall of France Orders of Battle'' for use with the Sitz Krieg Ohne Hass Rules. 

They have been based on the many available publications on the actual fighting formations of the combatant armies for the nations involved.

—description from the publisher

Name: Green vs Tan: Fury Farm Battleset
Description:
This product is for the original Green Vs. Tan: Where Dingos Dare skirmish game, and is essentially two things.
 - First, its a terrain pack to make your tabletop a bit more green, and/or a bit more tan, to aid in playing more amusingly immersive games. It serves to represent either a lovely little farmhouse in either Tanland or Greenland, complete with tractors, wells, haystacks, plenty of trees, supply crates, and what's that? 
TWO NEW CHARACTERS? Why yes! After all, no Fury Farm Battleset is ever complete with a set of new characters to send into battle alongside your Green Guard and Tanzer Elite veterans!

- For the second detail of what this product is, you'll find the agreeable Sergeant “Shooty” Sean representing the Green Guard, a rather light-footed fellow who is well known for his proficiency with the submachine gun. A good chap for all the sticky, tough jobs, Sean is also quite a card-player and is known for enjoying any and all types of Green Tea. Get it? Green tea!
And for the Tanzer Elite we have the mysterious, gas-mask wearing Sergeant “Shadowy” Sylvia, one of the few Tanzer Elite soldiers who made it through the Battle of Tanky Meadows and the Retreat Through Popsy Pass with all of her bits intact! Quiet, evasive, and somewhat eerie, she is known to other Tanzer Elite troops as a bit of a lone wolf, yet commands great respect due to her distinguished military career. Oh, and despite the rumors circulating amongst the Tan forces, she is not Sergeant "Blast" Belle, who also survived both Tanky Meadows and Popsy Pass, has many of the same combat distinctions and honors, and also hails from Tanzington.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jenga: Godzilla – Extreme Edition
Description: Classic Jenga reskinned and rethemed with a Godzilla mechanic that forces players to draw increasingly higher numbers of blocks on their turns.

Name: Trek 12: de la Saint Valentin
Description:
Trek 12 de la Saint Valentin is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in february 2021.

It consists in a new player board to play in duo. Play secretly, without looking at the board of the other. Start where you want, then follow the classic rules but with the specific INTENSITY and HARMONY rules and ways to score.

Name: Satisfy
Description:
Sexual communication is an extremely important part of any healthy relationship.

Satisfy is a game where two players act as partners, each trying to satisfy each other’s needs by following clues and trying their best to finish as simultaneously as possible.

The players each have a set of increasingly difficult secret Goals that they want to try to satisfy before their hand or the Stimulation Deck runs out of cards. These goals represent different arrangements of the markers on the Shared Experience board.

Inspired by such games as Fog of Love and Codenames, Satisfy will exercise your empathy and understanding by putting both of you in a vulnerable and often hilarious place.

Gameplay

In Satisfy, both players will take turns moving markers along the Shared Experience Board. Each column on the board represents a different aspect of a sexual encounter:


     Voice
     Touch
     Mouth
     Genitals


Both players will be moving the four markers up and down these tracks to match the increasingly difficult goal cards in front of their partner. There are five levels of goal cards, and once one is matched it is replace by one of the next higher level.

To move these markers, the players will take turns playing Stimulation cards. These cards indicate two colors whose markers will be pushed. As you play the card, you describe to 
your partner what you’re doing to them. Played cards are handed to your partner who adds them to their own hand.

When you match your goal, your partner will draw an Action card. These can be used assist you in your experience. When a final goal is met, begin discarding your Stimulation cards in a race to both finish as close to the same time as possible.

Inclusivity

All pronouns used in the game are non-gendered. This is a game for couples of any orientation or persuaion. The art on the cards features gay, straight, lesbian, and non-binary people.

It is intended for any couple willing to explore how they communicate with each other and are willing to have a fun time.

Name: Monopoly: Sapeurs-Pompiers de France
Description:
Monopoly: Sapeurs-Pompiers de France
 The National Federation of Firefighters of France honors firefighters at the heart of the famous Monopoly® game.

In this special edition, the aim will be to bring relief to the population during everyday incidents as well as during major events. 
A new fun opportunity to familiarize yourself with the world of firefighters, with family or friends.

Name: Trek 12: Philitrek
Description:
Trek 12: Philitrek is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the authors and a gameshop with the participation of Martin Vidberg.

It consists in a new player board and new ways to score. Go on the conquest of the PhiliMountain with this new ascension.

Name: Roll Call
Description:
The board for Roll Call is a 5x5 grid of dice combinations, some using four dice and some using five.

On a turn a player has three rolls of five dice to try to get a combination on any unowned space; if they manage this they claim such a space.

A player wins by claiming four squares in a row (in any direction) or any thirteen squares.

Name: Magnytour Profil: Tour d'Espagne – Vuelta
Description:
La Vuelta is one of the main cycling races on the international calendar. 
The third grand tour of the year.

This is the adaptation of the race to 10 stages Magnytour.

Name: Tick Tack Bumm: Vibrations
Description:
The bright berry-red bomb, which is known to end the round by exploding, also has another surprise in store: it vibrates randomly and once again makes the other players sweat.
